subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] mergers in dictionary, in news
msgSnippet: An excellent position to take. I merge all three letters myself, but have no problem reading each of the characters. I just don t know which one to use in any
messageBody:
An excellent position to take. I merge all three
letters myself, but have no problem reading each of
the characters. I just don't know which one to use in
any given case, since I can't hear the distinction
either.

Being 'maximalist' in this sense and using the full
strength of the excellent tool that QS is, is a very
good decision.

--- Paul Tremblay <phthenry@...> wrote:
> It occurred to me that I should build my dictionary
> by not merging Awl,

===========
Never insult anyone by accident.
- Robert A. Heinlein

letters myself, but have no problem reading each of
the characters. I just don't know which one to use in
any given case, since I can't hear the distinction
either.

   Being 'maximalist' in this sense and using the full
strength of the excellent tool that QS is, is a very
good decision.
